page.title: 09Churches in Greatworth
page.content: St. Peter's church is in a very poor state of repair at the moment. An appeal fund has been launched to raise money for repairs. Approx. Â£35,000 is needed to repair the tower and belfry and Â£5,000 is needed to repair the north east corner of the church. Its organisations include a Sunday School and Mothers Union. It shares a minister with Helmdon and Radstone. Local history tells us that the Methodist church was built in 1860. Its minister is part of the Banbury Methodist circuit and services are held at regular intervals. Repairs are also needed to this building. There is also a holiday club for the younger children during the summer months. The playgroup use the Methodist school room and meet twice a week. They accept children from the age of three years.
